document_title: Pork tapeworm disease: Signs, causes, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
Most of the body will have a self-protection and elimination mechanism, so only a few cases show signs, and in rare cases it can cause complications. Pork tapeworm larvae are most dangerous when parasitic in the brain and heart. When parasitic tapeworms can cause compression on nerves, affecting health and causing many serious complications.
If the cyst is parasitic in the brain, the patient may have headaches, paralysis, epilepsy or coma. Parasitic cysts in the heart can cause signs such as rapid heartbeat, difficulty breathing, and fainting. Or if parasitic cysts in the eye can cause vision loss, glaucoma, and blindness.
